subject: Law
title: Burden of Proof: Beyond Reasonable Doubt
description: A quick, practical guide to Burden of Proof: Beyond Reasonable Doubt.

hook.text: O.J. Simpson was acquitted of murder but found liable in civil court. Same facts, different standards of proof.

buildup.text: In criminal cases, the prosecution must prove guilt 'beyond a reasonable doubt'â€”the highest legal standard.

discovery.text: This means jurors must be firmly convinced. If there's a reasonable doubt, they must acquit.

twist.text: Civil cases use 'preponderance of evidence'â€”just over 50% likely. That's why Simpson lost the civil trial.

climax.text: The high criminal standard exists because liberty is at stake. Getting it wrong means an innocent person in prison.

punchline.text: Better ten guilty go free than one innocent suffer.

quiz.question: What is the standard of proof in criminal cases?
